name: General Knowledge 7 Quiz Challenge - How Much Do You Know? | Mixed 25 Questions

questions.text: Which word is derived from the first two letters of the Greek alphabet?
questions.explanation:
Alphabet.

	From the Greek 'alphabetos', the first two letters of the Greek alphabet (alpha and beta).

questions.text: Which country's name comes from the Latin word 'australis' meaning southern?
Although some starfish have a different number of legs, the majority have how many?
What was the nationality of Roald Amundsen who was the first person to reach the South Pole in 1911?
Gorillas are apes that live in the rainforests of West and Central...?
Which country's name means 'rich coast'?
The 'Little Mermaid' sits on a rock in the harbour of which European capital city?
Which element is NOT named after a Greek/Roman god?
questions.explanation:
Vanadium.

	Vanadium is name after Vanadis or Freyja (the Norse goddess of beauty and youth).

questions.text: The toucan is a bird that lives in the rainforests of which continent?
About how many muscles are there in the human body?
questions.explanation:
650.

	The body moves by means of muscles which work in pairs.

questions.text: Dabblers and divers are the two main types of what?
questions.explanation:
Ducks.

	'Dabblers' feed on the surface of the water and 'divers' swim under the water to get food.

questions.text: Which of the following has an orbit that is very eccentric, far from circular, and is not a gas giant but more like an asteroid?
What is the word for a marsupial mother's pouch?
questions.explanation:
Marsupium.

	Maseru is the capital of Lesotho and Maputo is the capital of Mozambique.

questions.text: Which of the following can stay underwater for the longest?
questions.explanation:
Seal.

	Sea otter (5 minutes), Platypus (10 minutes), Hippopotamus (15 minutes) and the seal (22 minutes). The Sperm whale for 112 minutes!

questions.text: What is the heaviest flying bird?
questions.explanation:
Kori bustard.

	Kori bustard comes from Africa and can weigh almost 20 kg.

questions.text: Which Australian aboriginal word means 'dead river'?
Which element is NOT named after a person?
questions.explanation:
Holmium.

	Curium (Pierre Curie) The husband of Marie Curie who with his wife discovered radium and polonium in 1898. Nobelium (Alfred Nobel) Swedish chemist who invented dynamite in 1866. Rutherfordium (Ernest Rutherford) New Zealand born physicist who discovered and named alpha and beta radiation and pioneered modern nuclear physics. Alas Holmium was not named after Sherlock Holmes but is a Latinized form of Stockholm.

questions.text: Which word is a French word that means 'twice cooked'?
What is the present biggest known carnivore?
questions.explanation:
Blue whale.

	The sperm whale hunts giant squid and huge fish in the ocean depths. The blue whale the largest mammal has its main diet krill (shrimplike marine crustaceans), and is also classified as a carnivore. Blue whales filter feed.

questions.text: During the 15th and 16th centuries, gold and silver mines of Central and South America, produced a flood of precious metal. 'Pieces of eight' were worth eight...?
questions.explanation:
Reals.

	Reals were the Spanish currency at the time.

questions.text: The world's largest optical telescope became operational in 1992. It is named 'Keck 1', has a 33 feet mirror and is located on which extinct volcano?
Which chemical elements are known as 'Kalium' and 'Natrium'?
Neptune's trident appears on the flag of which country?
questions.explanation:
Barbados.

	The flag is blue, yellow and blue vertical stripes. The trident appears in the yellow area.

questions.text: Of the 88 constellations, 'Aquarius' means water bearer, 'Cygnus' means swan and 'Draco' means dragon. What does 'Cassiopeia' mean?
Name the remote-controlled robotic explorer which was lowered into the Atlantic Ocean in 1985 to become the first vessel to find the wreck of the Titanic which sank in April 1912?
questions.explanation:
Argo.

	Four years later 'Argo' found the wreck of the German battleship 'Bismarck' which sunk in May 1941. Hope you enjoyed the Quiz. Quizzical is the name and quizzing you is the game.
